history.content: Hi! Just to clarify, as the CS 186 instructor: you can watch lecture fully remotely, as mentioned in emails I've sent to students who are curious, and you can do the project remotely (although we will only have office hours in person). Discussions will be completely optional, but are in-person. Lastly, exams are going to be fully and solely in-person, and there will be no remote option for those.

Hi! Just to clarify, as the CS 186 instructor: you can watch lecture and discussion fully remotely, as mentioned in emails I've sent to students who are curious, and you can do the project remotely (although we will only have office hours in person). However, exams are going to be fully and solely in-person, and there will be no remote option for those.

<md>Hello,


I'm currently a senior going into my last semester. I only need to take two upper division classes and the ethics requirement. However, I have had some family issues come up that require me to leave Berkeley, possibly for about a year. I would really not like to delay graduation for an entire year. I am currently on campus.


I'm currently enrolled in INFO 159, CS186, and CS195 for Spring 2022.


The CS186 professor has already told me that it would be possible to take the class fully remotely.

But the other two are not sure yet. Can anyone recommend some upper division CS classes and an ethics class that will have most components online? its fine if the exams or the occasional presentation or something is in person, I can just visit Berkeley temporarily for those. As long as the typically weekly things (lectures, mandatory discussions, hws) are available online, its fine.



I have taken CS161 and Data 100 already, plus a 194 class.


Thank you
</md>
history.subject: Attending Spring 2022 Semester Remotely
